user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of reply_with_main_page:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
reply_with_main_page (struct MHD_Connection *c)
{
  static const char page_content[] = MAIN_PAGE;
  static const size_t page_content_len =
    (sizeof(page_content) / sizeof(char)) - 1;
  struct MHD_Response *resp;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  resp = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (page_content_len, page_content)
  ;
  if (NULL == resp)
    return MHD_NO;

  /* Ignore possible error when adding the header as the reply will work even
     without this header. */
  (void) MHD_add_response_header (resp,
                                  MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE,
                                  "text/html");

  ret = MHD_queue_response (c, MHD_HTTP_OK, resp);
  MHD_destroy_response (resp);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I found no fragments that appear to be unreachable code. Reasons: 
- There are no conditional statements with a constant false condition (e.g. if (0)) or similar constructs that would make code unreachable. The only conditional (if (NULL == resp)) leads to a valid early return; the code after it is reachable when resp != NULL.
- There are no forward gotos, unused labels, dead-case switch constructs, or infinite loops that prevent execution of subsequent code.
- The standalone semicolon after the resp = ... call is an empty statement, not unreachable code.
- Static initializers (page_content, page_content_len) are compile-time/data definitions, not runtime unreachable statements.
- The (void) cast discarding MHD_add_response_header’s return value is an explicit ignore of a function result, not unreachable code.
- All other statements (queueing the response, destroying it, returning ret) are reachable in the normal control flow.

Therefore no code fragments need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 in this function.
